userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the researcher to obtain any necessary copyright clearances. Permission to publish material from Smith family letters must be obtained from the Supervisor of Reference Services and/or the L. Tom Perry Special Collections Board of Curators.

prefercite.p: Initial citation: MSS SC 131; Smith family letters; 19th Century Western and Mormon Manuscripts; L. Tom Perry Special Collections, Harold B. Lee Library, Brigham Young University. Following citations: MSS SC 131, LTPSC.

appraisal.p: Utah and the American West and LDS cultural, social, and religious history (19th century Western and Mormon Manuscripts collection development policy).

scopecontent.p: ALS from Lewis Jones (Independence, Missouri) to Angeline Smith (Talladega, Alabama) informing her of her son, Lafayette's rescue from the Comanche Indians (1842); ALS from Frederick Forney Foscue (Rockford, Alabama) to John Smith (Cuero, Texas) telling of family happenings, with a very critical account of John P. Lee's marriage to a fourteen-year-old girl (1848); ALS from Sarah Meadows (Coosa, Alabama) to Maria Smith (Cuero, Texas) concerning family news, marriages, and deaty (1849); and an ALS from Carrie Smith (Colorado Springs, Colorado) to Mrs. M.B. Smith (Salt Lake City, Utah) regarding Lafayette Smith and family genealogy (1921).

custodhist.p: Gift of Mrs. Ralph Stewart and June S. Stage, 1974.
